intro: Glyptopetalum matsudae, commonly known as the Matsuda's rock orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers with intricate petal structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cool, humid environments. Its botanical features include a short, erect stem and narrow leaves, with flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
